Description: Cylinder seal of black steatite: perforated through the centre, bearing an incised inscription. Good condition.
Curator's comments: The appearance of this seal is not wholly convincing, although the rough carving of many Early Dynastic inscriptions makes it difficult to say with any degree of certainty that this object is modern. Bibliography: P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964), pl. 119, abb. 715; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit II (Wiesbaden, 1964), 1181.
Exhibition history: 2015, 19th June - 5th Sept. Wrexham County Borough Museum. Egyptian Written Culture. 2016 12 Mar-8 May, Carlisle, Tullie House, Writing for Eternity 2016 20 May-4 Sept, The Salisbury Museum, Writing for Eternity 2016 16 Sept-10 Jan 2017, Abergavenny Museum, Writing for Eternity 2017 21 Jan-21 May, Museum of Hartlepool, Writing for Eternity
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev George Denis Nash
